questions.question: This is one of the best novels that ……………….. appeared this year.
questions.description: The verb in the relative clause should agree with the number and person of the antecedent of the relative pronoun.

questions.question: The boy …………………….. I trusted proved worthy of my confidence.
questions.description:
The boy proved worthy of my confidence.
I trusted him.
The relative pronoun whom replaces words like him, her and them. When we combine them we use whom instead of him.

questions.question: Ambition is one of those passions that ………………………. never satisfied.
questions.description: The verb in the relative clause should agree with the number and person of the antecedent of the relative pronoun.

questions.question: This is the same man ……………………….. we saw yesterday.
questions.description: When the antecedent is same, the consequent should be as or that.

questions.question: He has an impudence ………………………… carry him through anything.
questions.description: When the relative pronoun is the subject of the relative clause, it cannot be omitted.

questions.question: You and ………………………. are invited to tea this morning.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject should be in its subject form.

questions.question: Are they better qualified than ………………………… to judge?
questions.description: Subject pronouns are not normally used after than if it is not followed by a verb.

questions.question: Neither of them ………………………….. invited to the party.
questions.description: The distributive pronouns each, either and neither are followed by a singular verb.

questions.question: The athlete, ……………………………. you spoke so highly of, has failed to qualify for the race.
questions.description:
The athlete has failed to qualify for the race. You spoke so highly of him. 
The relative pronoun whom replaces words like him, her and them.

questions.question: When you have examined these documents please return ………………………. to us.
questions.description: Avoid the use of same as a substitute for the personal pronoun.

questions.question: They know it as well as ……………………… do.
questions.description: Here the pronoun I is the subject of the verb do.

questions.question: He is as good a bowler as ....................................
questions.description: After as and than we can use an object pronoun or a subject pronoun + verb.

questions.question: The horse and carriage ………………….. waiting at the door.
questions.description: The verb is singular when two or more nouns suggest one idea to the mind or refer to the same person or thing.

questions.question: No nook or corner ……………………. left unexplored.
questions.description: Two or more singular subjects connected by or require a singular verb.

questions.question: The quality of the apples ………………………… not very good.
questions.description: Here the proper subject is the singular expression ‘quality’ and hence the verb should be singular.

questions.question: His knowledge of Indian languages ……………………….. commendable.
questions.description: Here the proper subject is the singular expression ‘knowledge’ and hence the verb should be singular.

questions.question: Excessive consumption of beverages such as tea and coffee …………………….adverse effects on health.
questions.description: Here the proper subject is the singular expression ‘consumption’ and hence the verb should be singular.

questions.question: The rise and the fall of the tide ……………………… due to the influence of the moon.
questions.description: The verb is singular when two or more nouns suggest one idea to the mind or refer to the same person or thing.

questions.question: Please allow John and ………………………. to go to the movies.
questions.description: Here the noun John and the pronoun me are the objects of the verb allow. Pronouns used as objects should be in their object form.

questions.question: He is as good a player as ……………………
questions.description: Either I am or me is possible here. The subject pronoun is not normally used after ‘as’ without a following verb.

questions.question: All passengers must buy …………………… tickets.
questions.description: A pronoun must agree with its antecedent in number, gender and person.

questions.question: Every man must bear ………………….. own burden.
questions.description: A pronoun must agree with its antecedent in number, gender and person.

questions.question: Each girl gave ……………………… own version of the story.
questions.description: A pronoun must agree with its antecedent in number, gender and person.

questions.question: I am not one of those who believe everything ……………………. hear.
questions.description: Here the pronoun 'they' refers back to 'those'.
